comment: Idk why he feels the need to be rude to his students. We are still in a pandemic but he doesn't seem to care at all about that or the well-being of students. He makes stuff due super early at the most inconvenient times, it's like he wants us to fail. I swear he thrives off making his students miserable. Doesn't even teach just makes us read stuff
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Professor Price is very kind and knowledgeable. His instructions on projects and assignments can be difficult to understand but he is not a hard grader and most projects are opinion-based. The homework and homework quizzes can be a lot but all the information can be found on Quizlet to help. Not a hard class but you do have to put some time in.

I took this class thinking it would be easy but the work load was a lot we had weekly readings which were very long and had around 40 or so questions to go with it. Every other week would be a quiz and if you dont fully understand what music your listening to for it you will fail them.

He's a pretty nice professor, but his instructions for projects and papers are very unclear. His assignments all have weird due times. The material is definitely not beginner friendly. I have been in music for 7+ years, and I found it incredibly hard. Almost all the material is from the book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: The way the online class is organized could be better since I had Groupme to help with misunderstandings. Some of the due dates have odd hours, there are even times people assumed it was 12 AM (Midnight) but it was 12 PM (Afternoon). He stopped responding to my emails halfway through the semester, but his grading is very generous.

I dont know if it was the online format of our class or what this semester, but he was super cranky all the time especially when students had technical difficulties. The homeworks were easy and the quizzes were a bit hard but just took time. The projects are the biggest part of the grade tho and should be done asap. (For honors class fyi)
Loved this guy for my honors gen ed music class. He was very well respected and even though assignments were heavy reading, he always welcomed questions and was willing to give help! GREAT PROFESSOR.

Not the best at giving good feedback and constantly struggled with technological problems even late in the semester but does not take his class more seriously than he needs to and doesn't use a lockdown browser for tests. Overall, he is a good teacher and an easy A.

Definitely tries to make lectures interesting. Three group projects that required a presentation AND a paper, in addition to three concert reports, two reaction papers, lecture presentation, and fourteen chapters of reading. No tests, but seven 30-60 question quizzes that take an hour. IMO too much work for a 1000 class but easy grader
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Solid choice for Music in Society class. Hes very straight forward with grading. Class is made up of reading the chapters & testing your knowledge, listening to music from the chapter, quizzes, group projects, and a few short papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great choice for MUSI1107! Clear expectations, accessible, and caring. Quizzes and assignments are online. Easy A.

Dr. Price's online class is great. Be mindful of the schedule is all I'd say, I had a busy week or two and forgot to do assignments outside of the textbook work, but he was understanding and let me do it after I emailed him explaining what happened.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Bless him. Understands you probably dont care about music. owns up to his own mistakes and doesnt make students grades suffer because of it. Understanding and wants you to succeed. Gives extra credit opportunity. I literally got a 100. Highly recommend for an online mandatory class.

Perfect for an online class. Stuff do every week basically but it isn't hard work. Everything is on quizlet; reading the textbook is not a requirement. Two group projects that are annoying but not hard. Three concerts w summaries (again, annoying but not hard.) He's a fair grader and doesn't expect a lot from students. Would take him again.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I took this music class online in the Fall. It consists of textbook work, discussion post, going to three concerts, and a group project at the end of the semester. Overall, an easy A as long as you complete the assignments and he is an easy grader.

The class was a lot of work if you actually wanted to learn something, but otherwise quizlet made it into an easy A. Finish the work and you get that A. Its not for someone who wants to learn something from the course but if you just want an easy A, this is the class you should take. Easy grader.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I had a lot of family issues mid way through the semester and Dr. Price could not have been more understanding. He was incredibly easy to be in contact with and did everything he could to make sure I had the help I needed. Would highly recommend.

Easiest Class I've ever taken, took this class online to fill the art/humanities requirement. I'm so glad I did it was one of the easiest classes I've taken , if you get a chance to take this class online I highly recommend.

A bit of a goof. Not the most professional and often has technological issues. No tests. Online work is mostly with the book ($40 book i think and 6-7 hours in total of work). Lots of projects so prepare to work with random class mates. Must go to 3 concerts 2 on campus 1 at ASO ($35 minimum. KSU discount is worthless). Overall easy, but boring.

I took this class online for an easy A. The class itself was not overly difficult (lots of busy work!) but it was so hard for me to figure out what I was supposed to be doing. Make sure you turn in all the work and you should be good. Online group projects which were confusing but easy A's.

Took this class online because who actually wants to sit in class for it??? I actually liked this online. No exams, just tons of chapter quizzes (super easy), 2 group projects, and 3 concert reports. Definitely an easy A if you remember to complete quizzes. Lots of extra credit too!

All things considered, Dr. Price is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He teaches on the principle that learning is for those who want to learn. Yes, it is possible to get an A with little effort. But this professor's passion for music and music history makes it hard not to learn anything. This class is for musicians and non-musicians alike.

Caring professor that wants his students to come out with a better understanding of music. Not difficult at all. Lots of online quizzes to do for homework, but they have unlimited tries. No tests, no quizzes. 3 short essay papers for concerts.

The most boring class I've ever sat through in my life, but also the easiest A possible. Attendance is only mandatory on like 2 days out of the semester. No tests, only quizzes through the textbook online (dont buy the real version, get the online one for $45). Quizzes are easy but tedious. Have to attend 3 concerts. Thats it thats the whole class.

The professor himself is a caring and thoughtful person, but the class itself is dull and unpleasant. Too much meaningless information is passed through in each period, with him shouting at the entire class most of the time. You won't learn anything because the course material is going so fast. However, it is an easy, easy A.

Professor Price was extremely helpful, kind and understanding. He rarely takes attendance unless students are presenting projects. You have to take online quizzes. Mine was totally messed up and he helped me figure it out on multiple occasions. He is extremely patient and passionate about music. It would be a mistake not to take him!

CLASS TAKEN: Music Appreciation  LECTURES: Goes through power points the whole time  HOMEWORK: Short online quiz on each chapter. Really easy, but about 5 quizzes per week.   GRADING: Quizzes grades themselves. Cumulative final.   TESTS/QUIZES: Short quizzes online per week, no tests. Just final.
Dr. Price always made the material interesting and relatable by including many different music types. I very fun and easy class.

I took the 4 week online and I cant believe the amount of work! tons of quizzes (I counted 88,) two group projects both with papers one with power point (minimum of 10 slides,) two mandatory concerts (one being the Atlanta symphony) each with 250-500 word essays, and two videos with 250-500 word response. Very unclear, have to work hard for an A.
This teacher wasn't really helpful, he normally yelled at the back of the class, and was always cranky. Don't take his morning class.

He is a horrible teacher. Didnt follow the book so it was confusing. Didnt even tell the class he put up a review guide for our test. He is very unclear most of the time and is sometimes useless. Luckily for me I played saxophone for 8 years so I have some musical knowledge. I feel bad for those who dont cause theyre struggling more than me.
